intro: Erysimum stigmatosum, commonly known as the stigmatose wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. It produces bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The leaves are linear and often covered in a fine layer of white or gray hairs.
